name: The Barns Hotel

reviews.text: My husband's sister chose this venue to get married - the Tithe barn attached to the hotel is beautiful and the food was pretty good. Fortunately the majority of our stay was spent in the barn. Our experience of the actual hotel was much less positive. On arriving at the hotel we discovered that our room was being redecorated, so while we dropped our bags off we had to manouvre around a man painting the door, we were also unable to shut the door until going to bed, which meant that we had to leave our suitcase with all our belongings in the room, which anyone could walk into. However, the redecoration was much needed. Our room was horrible, especially the tatty bathroom, and was very grubby - certainly not worth the price we paid for the room. You are much better off booking into a travelodge (although the breakfast here was quite good).
reviews.title: Over-priced

reviews.text: We had a family Reunion here to include cousins from South Africa and cousins I had never met and the staff of the Barns couldn't have been more helpful. We had a lunch overlooking the river for 10 people. The table was beautifully decorated with fresh flowers and the food was very good. We spent the afternoon catching up with family in the snack bar, which we basically took over and again the staff made us so comfortable and even took group photos with eight different cameras! We also had dinner for 7 and a child which was delicious and we were waited on hand and foot. The rooms we had were very comfortable, large and spotlessly clean. I have travelled all over the world and stayed in 5* hotels and this one is hard to beat and the setting is really beautiful. I really can't say enough about the staff as they really did go out of their way to make it a very special stay.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for a Reunion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as a birthday treat for me. I'd stayed there many years ago and it had been great - how things change! There were two weddings on at the time, each of them a poor imitation of Jordan & Peter Andre. Our room was next to the main function room and we were kept awake until 2am with loud music and drunken behaviour from the guests.
reviews.title: Simply Awful!

likes.disliked: — Service and noise from wedding parties

reviews.title: Very pretty, homely yet modern hotel
reviews.text: Our room was supposedly a suite, but was small, cramped and hadn't been refurbished in about 20 years. A severe "trades descriptions" issue going on here! The bedcover had a very suspect stain on it, although the other linen appeared clean enough.

reviews.title: Never Again
reviews.text: Customer service was awful - we missed the buffet breakfast as the waiters cleared it away before we could help ourselves. They could see us sitting in the dining room, but couldn't be bothered to come over - no-one offered to make us anything, either and it wouldn't have hurt.

reviews.title: A nice place to spend a night
reviews.text: If you have to visit Bedford then this establishment is sufficiently far away not to really count as a Bedford Hotel. The reception was welcoming, even at the ridiculous hour of my arrival....and the room was clean and comfortable.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel
reviews.text: The food and the restaurant were most acceptable...I found myself drawn in there by the excellent smell of food and I was not disappointed. Very good food at a very good price.

description: The Barns Hotel is situated in a beautiful riverside location, within three and a half acres of landscaped gardens, yet it is just 10 miles from the M1 and 8 miles from A1. The tranquil setting offers Bedford accommodation with views of the great River Great Ouse and the local country park and wonderful grounds in which to stroll and relax. Come and join us for a beautiful and relaxing stay!
